section.title: What is the USI?
section.para: On 1 January 2015 the Australian Commonwealth government introduced a Unique Student Identifier which will be issued to every student undertaking vocational training. Eventually this USI will be issued to every child starting primary school and every student at university. The USI is similar to existing identity systems already in place in Australia: medicare number, tax file number, driver's license, etc. but it is not printed on an identity card and it is illegal for RTOs to print them on identity cards or certificates.

The USI can only be issued by the USI agency in response to a request from a student who comes with certain idenfication papers. Medicare cards, driver's licenses, birth certificates and passports are probably the most common forms of identification which can be used.

section.title: Requirements and limitations
section.para:
The USI legislation puts certain limitations on how the USI can be used and how it must be reported.
The USI cannot be printed on certificates. None of the default certificates in onCourse include the USI.
The USI must be verified by the RTO. onCourse has a special feature to automate this process.
You may not issue a certificate to a student until you have their USI and have verified it. onCourse will allow you to create Certificate records but not print them until the USI is verified. You can override this behaviour with the appropriate administrator rights, but you must then ensure you have implemented another verification process in your RTO.
The USI is a new field in all AVETMISS 7 flavours.

section.title: Capturing the USI
section.para: The USI need not be captured at the time of enrolment, but typically you'll want to have it entered and verified before the class is completed in order to not delay issuing of certificates.

section.title: Manual entry
section.para: When you create a new student or update an existing one, you can type the USI directly into the field available on the "VET" tab. This can also be done directly within the Quick Enrol process. The USI will be checked for validity (it is the correct length and matches a checksum) and then verified against the USI agency.

section.title: Student self-service
section.para: If you don't capture the USI from the student manually, onCourse will send the student an email to request the details. This is done in the enrolment confirmation email and again every Monday at 9am until the class is complete or the USI is entered. You can modify these templates or alter the script which sends these weekly emails. Note that students are only sent this email if they are enrolled in a VET flagged class, to avoid bothering your students engaging in non-VET training.

caption.para: An example of a confirmation email with USI information

section.para: Once the student gets the email requesting their USI, they will be able to click on a link which takes them directly to a page within the skillsOnCourse portal. They will not require a password and the link will be valid for 3 days from the email being sent. The URL is cryptographically signed so that they will not work after the expiry date and they will not be transferrable between students.

The skillsOnCourse portal page will explain the USI to the student and give them a convenience link to create or recover a USI if they don't have one or have forgotten it. This has been optimised so that it can be used on mobile and tablet devices. The student will be able to enter the USI and onCourse will handle the verification process automatically.

The student will be asked to complete three steps: first their date of birth and USI, then the standard AVETMISS questions which can be skipped and finally some additional information such as a driver's license to validate the USI. If the USI agency reports back that the student's name is wrong (for example, they changed their name after getting married) then onCourse will give them the opportunity to fix this.

section.title: Verifying the USI
section.para: If you entered the USI manually, or the student entered it online, the USI will automatically be verified against the USI agencies system. In order for this process to work we will require a special authorisation key called an auskey from you and linked to your RTO. Please contact your onCourse account manager to assist you with this process. Unfortunately this system will not work for onCourse community edition users who don't have a support agreement with ish. In that case, you can still capture the USI within onCourse but you will not be able to take advantage of the online student self-service process or the automatic verification process.
